explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. The product is stable to heat (up to 350degC) and thus considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures (Triethylamine salt, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), which could be "Not classified."

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. The product is stable to heat (up to 350degC) (Triethylamine salt, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), which could be "Not classified."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 148-150degC (ICSC (2006))).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,140mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >3,980mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >5.43mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of mild to moderate irritation, which persisted for up to day 7, observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests and rat in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "piloerection," "tremors," and "convulsions" (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1996)): "changes in the renal tubular epithelium" observed at dose levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=1.2mg/L of the fish (Pink Salmon) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=2.53(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 2.
